intro: Boehmeria microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited nettle, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles. Boehmeria microcarpa is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. It has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antipyretic properties.
